1: In the year that the supreme commander, sent by Sargon the king of Assyria, came to Ashdod, attacked it, and captured it—
2: at that time the Lord spoke through Amoz's son Isaiah: “Go loosen the sackcloth that's around your waist,[a] and take your sandals[b] off your feet.” So that's what he did: he went around naked and barefoot.
3: Then the Lord said, “Just as my servant Isaiah has walked around naked and barefoot for three years as a sign and a warning for Egypt and Ethiopia,[c]
4: so the king of Assyria will lead away the Egyptian captives and exiles from Cush,[d] both the young and the old, naked and barefoot—with even their buttocks uncovered—to the shame[e] of Egypt.
5: Then they will be dismayed and put to shame because of Cush,[f] their hope, and Egypt, their jewel.[g]
6: At that time, the inhabitants of this coastland will say, 'See, this is what has happened to those on whom we counted and relied[h] for help and deliverance from the king of Assyria! How, then, can we escape?'”
